intro: Hieracium lawsonii var. ericetorum, commonly known as the Ericaceous Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, acidic soils, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Due to its preference for specific habitats, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
